intro: Thalictrum amoenum, commonly known as the white avens, is a flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant features delicate, feathery leaves and clusters of small, white, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Thalictrum amoenum is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for early pollinators.
